perturbation.original_text: A. Licensee owns and operates the following radio station (the "Station") pursuant to licenses issued by the Federal Communications Commission ("FCC"): WQHT-FM, New York, NY (Facility ID No. 19615). The Station has the capability to transmit an in-band, on-channel ("IBOC") digital broadcast signal.
perturbation.changed_text: A. Licensee may operate the following broadcasting source (the "Station") with permissions granted by the Federal Communications Commission ("FCC"): WQHT-FM, New York, NY (Facility ID No. 19615). The Station may experiment with various forms of signal transmission, including in-band, on-channel ("IBOC") digital broadcasts.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states ownership and operation 'pursuant to licenses'. The modified text uses 'may operate' and 'permissions granted,' weakening the commitment to operate under FCC licenses and introducing uncertainty. The original statement about transmission capability is replaced with permission to 'experiment,' further deviating from the regulated nature of broadcast signals.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Communications Act and FCC regulations regarding licensed operation of radio stations.

perturbation.original_text: 6. Operation, Ownership and Control of the Station. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement Licensee will have full authority, power and control over the operation of the Station, including the HD2 Channel, and over all persons working at the Station's facilities during the Term. Licensee will bear the responsibility for the Station's compliance with all applicable provisions of the rules and policies of the FCC.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. Operation, Ownership and Control of the Station. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, both Licensee and Programmer will collaborate equally in the operation of the Station, including the HD2 Channel, and share authority over all persons working at the Station's facilities during the Term. Licensee and Programmer will attempt to share the responsibility for the Station's compliance with the general spirit of the rules and policies of the FCC.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives the Licensee full authority and responsibility for FCC compliance. The modified text introduces shared authority and responsibility between the Licensee and Programmer. This directly contradicts the FCC's requirement that the licensee maintains ultimate control over the station's operation and compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FCC regulations regarding licensee responsibility and control over broadcast stations.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 Political Time. Licensee shall oversee and take ultimate responsibility with respect to the provision of equal opportunities, lowest unit charge, and reasonable access to political candidates, and compliance with the political broadcast rules of the FCC.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 Political Time. Licensee and Programmer will collaborate on matters pertaining to equal opportunities, lowest unit charge, and reasonable access to political candidates; final decisions will be based on mutual agreement and business considerations, rather than strict adherence to the political broadcast rules of the FCC.
perturbation.explanation: The original text assigns 'ultimate responsibility' to the Licensee for compliance with political broadcast rules. The revised text introduces collaboration and decision-making based on 'mutual agreement and business considerations,' which dilutes the Licensee's responsibility. This creates ambiguity and a potential conflict with FCC regulations regarding political broadcasting and equal opportunity rules.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Communications Act of 1934, as amended, and FCC regulations regarding political broadcasting, including equal opportunity and reasonable access rules.
